attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

set -ex

DATA_DISK=$(/usr/bin/lsscsi | egrep -v "sda|sr0" | tail -n 1 | awk '{print $NF}')
sudo /usr/sbin/pvcreate -y $DATA_DISK
sudo /usr/sbin/vgcreate rally $DATA_DISK
sudo /usr/sbin/lvcreate -y -l 100%VG -n rally rally
sudo /usr/sbin/mkfs.xfs /dev/mapper/rally-rally
sudo /usr/bin/mkdir -p /data/rally
sudo /usr/bin/mount /dev/mapper/rally-rally /data/rally
sudo echo -e "/dev/mapper/rally-rally \t /data/rally \t xfs \t defaults,auto,noexec \t 0 0" >> /etc/fstab

sudo /usr/bin/yum update yum -y
sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y wget
sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y java-1.8.0-openjdk-devel

sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y epel-release
sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y gcc python34.x86_64 python34-devel.x86_64 python34-pip.noarch
#sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y git

sudo yum groupinstall -y "Development Tools"
sudo yum install -y gettext-devel openssl-devel perl-CPAN perl-devel zlib-devel curl-devel
sudo yum install -y autoconf autogen
sudo /usr/bin/wget https://github.com/git/git/archive/v2.21.0.tar.gz -O git.tar.gz
sudo /usr/bin/tar xvf /root/git.tar.gz
cd /root/git-2.21.0
#pwd
sudo /usr/bin/make configure
sudo /root/git-2.21.0/configure --prefix=/usr/local
sudo /usr/bin/make install 

sudo /usr/local/bin/pip3 install esrally
#sudo /usr/bin/pip install --upgrade pip

/usr/local/bin/esrally configure --advanced-config << EOF
    /data/rally
    
    
    
EOF

sudo systemctl stop firewalld || true
sudo systemctl disable firewalld || true

action_list.description: System action for creating an application
action_list.name: action_create

action_list.description: System action for uninstalling an application
action_list.name: action_uninstall

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash 

set -ex

HOST=$(hostname)
#echo $HOST

/usr/bin/rpm --import https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch

cat >>/etc/yum.repos.d/kibana.repo <<EOF
[kibana-6.x]
name=Kibana repository for 6.x packages
baseurl=https://artifacts.elastic.co/packages/6.x/yum
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch
enabled=1
autorefresh=1
type=rpm-md
EOF

sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y kibana 

#IP_ADDRESS=$(ip a show dev eth0 | grep -w inet | awk '{print $2}' | sed 's/\/22//')
sudo sed -i 's/^#server.port: 5601/server.port @@{kibana_port}@@/' /etc/kibana/kibana.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#server.host: "localhost"/server.host @@{KibanaAHV.address}@@/' /etc/kibana/kibana.yml
sudo sed -i "s/^#server.name: \"your-hostname\"/server.name: $HOST/" /etc/kibana/kibana.yml
sudo sed -i 's%^#elasticsearch.hosts: \["http://localhost:9200"\]%elasticsearch.hosts: \["http://@@{Search_Index.address}@@:@@{elastic_http_port}@@"\]%' /etc/kibana/kibana.yml

sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo /bin/systemctl daemon-reload
sudo /bin/systemctl enable kibana.service
sudo /bin/systemctl start kibana.service

action_list.description: System action for creating an application
action_list.name: action_create

action_list.description: System action for uninstalling an application
action_list.name: action_uninstall

action_list.description: System action for installing an application
action_list.name: action_install

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

set -x

/usr/bin/sudo /usr/sbin/swapoff -a 
/usr/bin/sed -i.bak -r 's/(.+ swap .+)/#\1/' /etc/fstab

sudo /usr/bin/rpm --import https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch

sudo cat > /etc/yum.repos.d/elasticsearch.repo <<EOF
[elasticsearch-6.x]
name=Elasticsearch repository for 6.x packages
baseurl=https://artifacts.elastic.co/packages/6.x/yum
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch
enabled=1
autorefresh=1
type=rpm-md
EOF

sudo yum install -y  elasticsearch 
sudo yum install -y java-1.8.0-openjdk-devel

sudo sed -i 's/#cluster.name: my-application/cluster.name: @@{elastic_cluster_name}@@/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/#node.name: node-1/node.name: ${HOSTNAME}/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i '$ a node.data: true' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i '$ a node.master: true' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's%path.data: /var/lib/elasticsearch%path.data: @@{elastic_data_path}@@%' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#bootstrap/bootstrap/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#network.host: 192.168.0.1/network.host: _eth0:ipv4_/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#http.port: 9200/http.port: @@{elastic_http_port}@@/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#discovery.zen.minimum_master_nodes:/discovery.zen.minimum_master_nodes: 1/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml  

sudo sed -i 's/-Xms1g/-Xms@@{java_heap_size}@@g/' /etc/elasticsearch/jvm.options
sudo sed -i 's/-Xmx1g/-Xmx@@{java_heap_size}@@g/' /etc/elasticsearch/jvm.options

sudo cat > /etc/sysctl.d/vm.conf <<EOF
vm.swappiness=0
vm.max_map_count=262144
vm.dirty_background_ratio=1
vm.dirty_ratio=40
EOF

sudo mkdir -p /etc/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service.d
sudo cat > /etc/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service.d/override.conf << EOF
[Service]
LimitMEMLOCK=infinity
EOF

sudo /usr/sbin/sysctl --system

#/usr/bin/lsscsi | /usr/bin/awk '{print $6}' | /usr/bin/grep /dev/sd | /usr/bin/grep -v sda | /usr/bin/xargs pvcreate
DISKS=$(/usr/bin/lsscsi | /usr/bin/egrep -v "sr|sda" | /usr/bin/awk '{print $NF}' | /usr/bin/tr '\n' ' ')
sudo /usr/sbin/pvcreate $(echo $DISKS)
sudo /usr/sbin/vgcreate esdata $(echo $DISKS)
sudo /usr/sbin/lvcreate -y -i 6 -l 100%VG -n esdata esdata
sudo /usr/sbin/mkfs.xfs /dev/mapper/esdata-esdata
sudo sleep 30
sudo /usr/bin/mkdir -p /elastic/esdata01
sudo /usr/bin/mount /dev/mapper/esdata-esdata @@{elastic_data_path}@@
sudo echo -e "/dev/mapper/esdata-esdata \t @@{elastic_data_path}@@ \t xfs \t defaults,auto,noexec \t 0 0" >> /etc/fstab
sudo /usr/bin/chown -R elasticsearch:elasticsearch /elastic/esdata01

sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo /bin/systemctl daemon-reload
sudo /bin/systemctl enable elasticsearch.service
sudo /bin/systemctl start elasticsearch.service

action_list.description: System action for creating an application
action_list.name: action_create

action_list.description: System action for uninstalling an application
action_list.name: action_uninstall

sudo sed -i 's/^#bootstrap/bootstrap/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#network.host: 192.168.0.1/network.host: _eth0:ipv4_/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#http.port: 9200/http.port: @@{elastic_http_port}@@/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#discovery.zen.minimum_master_nodes:/discovery.zen.minimum_master_nodes: 1/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml  

sudo sed -i 's/-Xms1g/-Xms@@{java_heap_size}@@g/' /etc/elasticsearch/jvm.options
sudo sed -i 's/-Xmx1g/-Xmx@@{java_heap_size}@@g/' /etc/elasticsearch/jvm.options

sudo cat > /etc/sysctl.d/vm.conf <<EOF
vm.swappiness=0
vm.max_map_count=262144
vm.dirty_background_ratio=1
vm.dirty_ratio=40
EOF

sudo mkdir -p /etc/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service.d
sudo cat > /etc/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service.d/override.conf << EOF
[Service]
LimitMEMLOCK=infinity
EOF

sudo /usr/sbin/sysctl --system

#/usr/bin/lsscsi | /usr/bin/awk '{print $6}' | /usr/bin/grep /dev/sd | /usr/bin/grep -v sda | /usr/bin/xargs pvcreate
DISKS=$(/usr/bin/lsscsi | /usr/bin/egrep -v "sr|sda" | /usr/bin/awk '{print $NF}' | /usr/bin/tr '\n' ' ')
sudo /usr/sbin/pvcreate $(echo $DISKS)
sudo /usr/sbin/vgcreate esdata $(echo $DISKS)
sudo /usr/sbin/lvcreate -y -i 6 -l 100%VG -n esdata esdata
sudo /usr/sbin/mkfs.xfs /dev/mapper/esdata-esdata
sudo sleep 30
sudo /usr/bin/mkdir -p /elastic/esdata01
sudo /usr/bin/mount /dev/mapper/esdata-esdata @@{elastic_data_path}@@
sudo echo -e "/dev/mapper/esdata-esdata \t @@{elastic_data_path}@@ \t xfs \t defaults,auto,noexec \t 0 0" >> /etc/fstab
sudo /usr/bin/chown -R elasticsearch:elasticsearch /elastic/esdata01

sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo /bin/systemctl daemon-reload
sudo /bin/systemctl enable elasticsearch.service
sudo /bin/systemctl start elasticsearch.service

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

set -x

/usr/bin/sudo /usr/sbin/swapoff -a 
/usr/bin/sed -i.bak -r 's/(.+ swap .+)/#\1/' /etc/fstab

sudo /usr/bin/rpm --import https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch

sudo cat > /etc/yum.repos.d/elasticsearch.repo <<EOF
[elasticsearch-6.x]
name=Elasticsearch repository for 6.x packages
baseurl=https://artifacts.elastic.co/packages/6.x/yum
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch
enabled=1
autorefresh=1
type=rpm-md
EOF

sudo yum install -y  elasticsearch 
sudo yum install -y java-1.8.0-openjdk-devel

sudo sed -i 's/#cluster.name: my-application/cluster.name: @@{elastic_cluster_name}@@/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/#node.name: node-1/node.name: ${HOSTNAME}/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i '$ a node.data: true' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i '$ a node.master: true' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's%path.data: /var/lib/elasticsearch%path.data: @@{elastic_data_path}@@%' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#bootstrap/bootstrap/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#network.host: 192.168.0.1/network.host: _eth0:ipv4_/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#http.port: 9200/http.port: @@{elastic_http_port}@@/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#discovery.zen.minimum_master_nodes:/discovery.zen.minimum_master_nodes: 1/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml  

sudo sed -i 's/-Xms1g/-Xms@@{java_heap_size}@@g/' /etc/elasticsearch/jvm.options
sudo sed -i 's/-Xmx1g/-Xmx@@{java_heap_size}@@g/' /etc/elasticsearch/jvm.options

sudo cat > /etc/sysctl.d/vm.conf <<EOF
vm.swappiness=0
vm.max_map_count=262144
vm.dirty_background_ratio=1
vm.dirty_ratio=40
EOF

sudo mkdir -p /etc/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service.d
sudo cat > /etc/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service.d/override.conf << EOF
[Service]
LimitMEMLOCK=infinity
EOF

sudo /usr/sbin/sysctl --system

#/usr/bin/lsscsi | /usr/bin/awk '{print $6}' | /usr/bin/grep /dev/sd | /usr/bin/grep -v sda | /usr/bin/xargs pvcreate
DISKS=$(/usr/bin/lsscsi | /usr/bin/egrep -v "sr|sda" | /usr/bin/awk '{print $NF}' | /usr/bin/tr '\n' ' ')
sudo /usr/sbin/pvcreate $(echo $DISKS)
sudo /usr/sbin/vgcreate esdata $(echo $DISKS)
sudo /usr/sbin/lvcreate -y -i 6 -l 100%VG -n esdata esdata
sudo /usr/sbin/mkfs.xfs /dev/mapper/esdata-esdata
sudo sleep 30
sudo /usr/bin/mkdir -p /elastic/esdata01
sudo /usr/bin/mount /dev/mapper/esdata-esdata @@{elastic_data_path}@@
sudo echo -e "/dev/mapper/esdata-esdata \t @@{elastic_data_path}@@ \t xfs \t defaults,auto,noexec \t 0 0" >> /etc/fstab
sudo /usr/bin/chown -R elasticsearch:elasticsearch /elastic/esdata01

sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo /bin/systemctl daemon-reload
sudo /bin/systemctl enable elasticsearch.service
sudo /bin/systemctl start elasticsearch.service

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

set -ex

DATA_DISK=$(/usr/bin/lsscsi | egrep -v "sda|sr0" | tail -n 1 | awk '{print $NF}')
sudo /usr/sbin/pvcreate -y $DATA_DISK
sudo /usr/sbin/vgcreate rally $DATA_DISK
sudo /usr/sbin/lvcreate -y -l 100%VG -n rally rally
sudo /usr/sbin/mkfs.xfs /dev/mapper/rally-rally
sudo /usr/bin/mkdir -p /data/rally
sudo /usr/bin/mount /dev/mapper/rally-rally /data/rally
sudo echo -e "/dev/mapper/rally-rally \t /data/rally \t xfs \t defaults,auto,noexec \t 0 0" >> /etc/fstab

sudo /usr/bin/yum update yum -y
sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y wget
sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y java-1.8.0-openjdk-devel

sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y epel-release
sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y gcc python34.x86_64 python34-devel.x86_64 python34-pip.noarch
#sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y git

sudo yum groupinstall -y "Development Tools"
sudo yum install -y gettext-devel openssl-devel perl-CPAN perl-devel zlib-devel curl-devel
sudo yum install -y autoconf autogen
sudo /usr/bin/wget https://github.com/git/git/archive/v2.21.0.tar.gz -O git.tar.gz
sudo /usr/bin/tar xvf /root/git.tar.gz
cd /root/git-2.21.0
#pwd
sudo /usr/bin/make configure
sudo /root/git-2.21.0/configure --prefix=/usr/local
sudo /usr/bin/make install 

sudo /usr/local/bin/pip3 install esrally
#sudo /usr/bin/pip install --upgrade pip

/usr/local/bin/esrally configure --advanced-config << EOF
    /data/rally
    
    
    
EOF

sudo systemctl stop firewalld || true
sudo systemctl disable firewalld || true

#!/bin/bash 

set -ex

HOST=$(hostname)
#echo $HOST

/usr/bin/rpm --import https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch

cat >>/etc/yum.repos.d/kibana.repo <<EOF
[kibana-6.x]
name=Kibana repository for 6.x packages
baseurl=https://artifacts.elastic.co/packages/6.x/yum
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch
enabled=1
autorefresh=1
type=rpm-md
EOF

sudo /usr/bin/yum install -y kibana 

#IP_ADDRESS=$(ip a show dev eth0 | grep -w inet | awk '{print $2}' | sed 's/\/22//')
sudo sed -i 's/^#server.port: 5601/server.port @@{kibana_port}@@/' /etc/kibana/kibana.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#server.host: "localhost"/server.host @@{KibanaAHV.address}@@/' /etc/kibana/kibana.yml
sudo sed -i "s/^#server.name: \"your-hostname\"/server.name: $HOST/" /etc/kibana/kibana.yml
sudo sed -i 's%^#elasticsearch.hosts: \["http://localhost:9200"\]%elasticsearch.hosts: \["http://@@{Search_Index.address}@@:@@{elastic_http_port}@@"\]%' /etc/kibana/kibana.yml

sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo /bin/systemctl daemon-reload
sudo /bin/systemctl enable kibana.service
sudo /bin/systemctl start kibana.service
